description.content:
Provide your own namespace or a new private ns will be
constructed automatically.

List of plugin names or constructors before class
is initialised, list of plugin instances after initialisation
function to call before or after intercepted method

optional, when to call interceptor
                        before | after | instead; default "before"

optional, return interceptor's return value
                 or original method's; default false
Implement new methods or properties on instance
Does this instance have a plugin
Get a bound to this object function

Destroy this instance. Also destroys plugins and calls all beforeDestroy and afterDestroy handlers. Also calls onDestroy.
Safe to call multiple times.
Overridable method. Put your destructor here
Create an instance of current class. Same as cls.factory(name)
Override class methods (on prototype level, not on instance level)
Create new class extending current one
All classes defined with cls extend this class. Basically,cls({}); is the same as BaseClass.$extend({}).
Instantiate class. Pass constructor parameters after "name"
Is given object instance of class
Is one class subclass of another class
Constructed class system. Also this is a function, same as cls.define

content.name: Class system
content.content:
Class system

If you import a ready-built package, class system will come already initalised in private namespace.
You can re-initialise by calling cls.classManagerFactory(ns) using Namespace instance from metaphorjs-namespace package.

content.name: Class lifecycle
content.content:
Class lifecycle

Initialization cycle

  1. $constructor() (call parent constructor with this.$super()). You don't usually use this unless you want to add instance plugins, re-implement or override methods or mess with the instance in any other way.
  2. mixin's $beforeInit() (mixins are not classes, they don't have $super(); '$beforeInit's are called in order mixins are specified)
  3. plugin's $beforeHostInit() (plugins are classes, they have their own $super())
  4. $init() (call parent $init with this.$super()). This is a constructor you should normally use. It will receive the same arguments as $constructor.
  5. mixin's $afterInit()
  6. plugin's $afterHostInit()

Destroy cycle (instance.$destroy())

  1. mixin's $beforeDestroy() method
  2. plugin's $beforeHostDestroy() method
  3. instance's onDestroy() method
  4. mixin's $afterDestroy method
  5. plugin's $destroy() method (with its own destroy cycle)

the $destroy method will nullify all instance properties and methods. If you want to prevent this, return false from your onDestroy() method.
